dist = Visual distance in m:
h = Height in m,
A = Acceleration in m/s² (optional), if not specified a = 9.80665

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Gravity effected on an object above a massive body
dist = Visual distance in m:
m = Mass of the body in kg, 
r = Radius of the body in m, 
h = Height above the body in m

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Checks if CelestLab toolbox is installed and loaded

dist = Visual distance in m:
m = Mass of the heaviest object in kg, 
r = distance at which the speed is to be calculated in m, 
A = length of the semi-major axis of the elliptical orbit. For the Earth at perihelion in m

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Atmospheric refraction of an apparent altitude
dist = Visual distance in m:
h_s: apparent altitude of the astronomical body in °, 
t:   temperatur in K (OPTIONAL), if not specified t=283K, 
P:   pressure in hPa (OPTIONAL), if not specified p=1010hPa
column6: You have to add the value to a calculated/real altitude to get the the observed altitude

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Atmospheric refraction elimination of an observed altitude
dist = Visual distance in m:
h_o: observed altitude of the astronomical body in °, 
t:   temperatur in K (OPTIONAL), if not specified t=283K, 
P:   pressure in hPa (OPTIONAL), if not specified p=1010hPa
column6:
You have to substract the value to a observed altitude to get the
 real altitude w/o atmospheric influence.

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Visual range w/ or w/o terrestrial refraction
dist = Visual distance in m:
height1 = height of eye/instrument in m, 
height2 = height of distant object in m, 
Refr = terrestrial refraction (OPTIONAL), set to 1 (no refraction) if not committed, refr = 1.13 is common value.
sigma = Atmosheric adsorption coefficien: range = visual range of sight in m
column6: Calculate how far you can see w/ or W/o terrestrial refraction correction. Mostly used for terestial views.

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Calculates how much a distant object is obscured by the earth's curvature
dist = Visual distance in m:
h1    = Eye height in m, 
dist  = target distance in m
sigma = Atmosheric adsorption coefficien: h2    = target hidden height in m

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Convert current day of the year to month and day
dist = Visual distance in m:
cday: current day of the year (1 .. 365 / 366 leap year), 
Year: year as 4-digit number (e.g. 2016)
sigma = Atmosheric adsorption coefficien:
month: month as a number (1 .. 12), 
Day  : day as a number (1 .. 31)

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Calculates whether the committed year is a leap year or not.
dist = Visual distance in m: year:    is the four-digit number of the year in question.
sigma = Atmosheric adsorption coefficien: leapYear : is a boolean which is TRUE if “year” is a leap year and FALSE if not.

Atmosheric adsorption coefficient: Exit pupil of an eye piece
dist = Visual distance in m:
lens_dia    = lens diameter in m(mm), 
lens_foclen = lens focal length in m(mm)
sigma = Atmosheric adsorption coefficien: exitPupil   = exit pupil of the eye piece in question m(mm)
